text: A city caught between the 12th century and the 20th; wher the medietal spires of the Tower of London compete for sp with office buildings of glass and steel. THE BULLDOZER rumbles through the city's afternoon traffi nearby COKSTRUCTION SITE. A high barrier surrounds the si which hangs A BANNER: JUBILEE LINE EXTENSION PROJECT: TAK INTO A NEW MILLENNIUM. The dezer stops by the banner, lowers its bucket to the ground. kevealed inside is a young passenger
age 12, a“forward moving chap” just stalled on the border puberty. % hops out of the bucket with a nod to the DRIVE
Cheers, Jake. Bookbag inone hand, some bags of fast-food in the other Quinn entess a door in the barrier marked SITE ENTRANCE.
Quinn walksthrough the site. Around him, WORKERS labor ov a lattice d girders. Huge CRANES lift material down a FIF FOOT WIDE WLE which leads to subway construction below.

Site forewoman KAREN ABERCROMBY stands by a table, going a schematic. She's a working class matron in her 40s, ful of life, sturdy as the buildings she's helped construct. assistant, STUART, nudges her.
There's your man. Karen looks up, sees Quinn approaching.
What're you doin' without a hat?
(Brandishing the food bags Bringin' you supper. Karen takes off her own hard hat, tosses it to Quinn.
! Aw, mum...
Oh, "Mum" yourself. You know you can't be here without protection.
Don't believe it, Quinn. If she'd had protection, you wouldn't be here at all. i KAREN Watch it, mate... A WORKMAN calls from nearby.
Karen! Jess needs you downstairs.
Can't it wait? We're just havin' our tea.
He says it's urgent. Karen sighs, puts down the food.
Can I come down? (CONTINUED)
No, love, they're still layin' in supports. (Kisses him on forehead.) ‘Nother time. Karen and Stuart head to the construction hole and enter cage-like ELEVATOR. With a metallic THUNK, the cage desce

Dark, recently dug walls of soft earth and clotted clay. entire tunnel resonates with GRINDING SOUNDS coming from A TUNNEL BORING MACHINE ("TBM"): a steel cylinder the siz several pick-up trucks. Its cutting edge is a series of hydraulic rams that dig into the earth before it. At the moment, the TBM is stuck into the earth at the tunnel’s end. It bucks and grinds, like an animal trying free itself from a trap. Karen and Stuart approach the TBM's operator cab. Inside, JESS, a portly, choleric Irishmen, fiddles with the contr
All right, Jess?
Damn stuck is what I am. (Jimmies controls) You geniuses tol' me it was clay down here. I'm hittin' bloody bedrock. Karen and Stuart look at each other, confused.
Bollocks. (Climbs into the cab.) There's no bedrock for miles.

Well, maybe if Your Ladyship'd learn to read the charts. Karen disregards him; she works the hydraulic controls. T TBM WHIRRS, begins to unjam itself from the wall. Stuart inspects the debris nearby. It's then he notices A TRICKLE OF WATER running from the cut the TBM has made the wall. It's as if the machine has hit a water main. (CONTINUED)
Oy, Karen! Hold...
SLAMS into Stuart, knocking him backward. ,

Stuart! Karen grabs his arm, pulls him up to the cab just as THE GUSH BECOMES A TORRENT, PUSHING THE TBM BACKWARD, lik cork forced from a bottle. KAREN, STUART AND JESS cling to the TBM cab for dear life Then, as quick as it came, the flood subsides. Soon, the only sound is the HISS of water STEAMING in the tunnel. aren rises unsteadily. She stares at what lies before the # LARGE HOLE, punctured in the wall by the TBM.

Unaware of the events below, Quinn sits reading a schoolb A distant CLANG splits the air. He looks up. The sound resonates from the spire of BIG BEN. It's 6:00 The famed clocktower is tolling in the coming night.
Holding her flashlight, Karen steps into the hole, follow by Stuart and Jess. They can see their breath MIST with c
Jesus! Water's bloody freezing.
Below freezing, mate. It's salt.
What the hell's salt water doing...? All come to a mute halt on the other side.
Good Christ. REVEAL they are in

100 feet high, but the dark makes it seem bigger. SHADOWS ODDLY SHAPED TRANSLUCENT STALACTITES AND STALAGMITES haun the space. Eeriest of all, however, are the PINPRICKS OF PHOSPHORESCENT LIGHT that dot the ceiling and walls. Thei dim, green glow make them look like subterranean stars. The three glance around nervously, their breath misting eerily before them.
Welcome to Wonderland, Alice. Stuart touches the glowing stuff on the wall.
Phosphorescent algae. What do you reckon?
Undersea cave maybe.
You daft? Ocean's miles from here.
Yes, your Lordship. And this country was under it.
What, ten thousand years ago?!

This must've gotten sealed off somehow. Karen and Stuart walk forward into the cavern. Jess, not so bold, takes a few steps back. SQUISH. His foot falls on something soft and wet. He look down at what he's stepped upon: A MASSIVE CABLE, stretching the length of the floor. Jess touches the thing with his boot. It's then he sees The Cable is covered with what seem to be HAIRS.
head into the cave. Karen trips on something. Stuart catc her. Karen turns her light to see on what she tripped on. (CONTINUED)

A BIZARRE FISH, prehistoric, almost alien looking, lies motionless on the ground. Stuart bends down to look at it STUART (cont'd) Jesus. Looks bloody primeval... Suddenly the fish THRASHES OUT, its spiny body nearly striking Stuart in the face. STUART (cont'd) Fuckin' hell! How can it be alive? THUD. A FAINT SOUND like a fist hitting an empty drum ech through the cavern.
Jess, what are you on about? No answer. Karen flashes her light around. No sign of him

Jess? Nothing. Karen and Stuart rise, calling Jess' name. Karen heads toward one end of the chamber. She comes to A CIRCULAR BOULDER set in the wall. 5-feet, shiny black. looks like an obsidian marble sunk halfway into the rock. STUART searches his end. ANOTHER THUD echoes through the cave, this one louder. He shines his light ahead...and freezes. For sprawled on ground before him is JESS. Eyes frozen open, blood trickling from his mouth. T "cable" he stepped on has WRAPPED ITSELF around his chest CRUSHING it like a tin-can.

Karen! Karen turns. The beam of her flashlight hits the surface the circular black boulder. THE COLOR OF THE BOULDER CHANGES: DEEP BLUE appears vertically on either end, widening so that all that's lef the black is m angry SLIT in the middle. It's not a barlder at all. (CONTINUED)

Karen finds herseif staring into an 4-FOOT EYE. Unnerving catlike; sky-blue iris; night-black pupil. She barely has time to react before SNAP! THE "CABLE" FLICKS OUT, SLAMMING Stuart against the wall with a sickening CRACK!

Stuart!! She runs to him. But by that time, all hell's broken loos The dull echoing thuds grow louder, quicker... MOVEMENT ail around. The strange translucent stalactites shift one way...parts of the walls shift another...THE EN CAVERN SEEMS TO BE ALIVE WITH A TRANSLUCENT FLESH. The thuds are now DEAFENING AND RHYTHMICAL. The sound of massive HEARTBEAT.

throws Strart over her back in a fireman's carry SNAP! ! The "Cable" STRIKES the ground nearby. Karen dodg with Stuart, makes for the cavern's exit. The "Cable" does not go after them. Rather, it WRAPS itse around TWO BOULDERS by the wall and drags them into an OPENING ir the cavern wall. Zn opening which we now see is a GIGANTIC MOUTH. And the cable is its massive TONGUE.
Karen runs with Stuart over her shoulder. She comes to a tunnel jumetion where SEVERAL WORKERS are busy.
Zeren, what's...?
Sreryone topside! NOW! In a burst adrenaline, she books for the elevator. The others folla.
The boulders start RATTLING within the mouth of the unsee Creature...like clicking flints trying to make a spark
begins to move out of its cavern into the tunnel.
A fiery sunset is reflected in the WINDOWS of nearby shop Suddenly, an ALARM STARTS TO SOUND.
The ground underneath the boy begins to TREMBLE. Quinn tr te rise, but is literally knocked off his feet as

head_text.subj: THE EARTH AROUND THE SITE STAPTS TO SHUDDER

text: CLANG! Karen SLAMS the elevator door shut. She, Stuart an the other workers are packed in like sardines. She presse the controls. The elevator SLOWLY begins to climb. The tunnel’s SHAKING. In the distance, a terrible RATTLIN
Workmen run for cover as girders fall around them. An ear piercing SCREECH OF METAL as a HUGE CRANES TOPPLES OVER.
Mum... ? Quinn looks toward the construction hole just as
rises from the hole. Quinn can see his mother and the oth caught in the cage. They're almost to safety when... THE RATTLING BELOW BECOMES DEAFENING.
Quinn, STAY BACK! STAY...
(CONTINUED)
Karer. and the others SCREAM as the elevator cage is CONS BY FIRE SO HOT IT INCINERATES THEM. The flaming elevator TOPPLES back into the hole.
Quinn runs to the collapsing elevator...then stops short. For something else is coming out to greet him.
painfully unfurls from the hole. Its flesh is withered, translucent from centuries without light. The sun shines through it, revealing a webwork of skeletal structure.
can cniy watch, paralyzed, as
joins the first, torturously stretching, hoisting its mai body from the hole. As light hits the creature's skin, its color CHANGES. Lik ghost taking form, the flesh becomes a dark, rich BLACK.
takes shape on the ground: a leviathan's silhouette of tw batlike wings and a gigantic, serpentine body.
stares mezcilessly. For an instant, Quinn's REFLECTED in thing's cornea. Captured, like an insect in a glass.
stares back in terror as the CREATURE'S SHADOW covers him blots out the remainder of light, taking us into
Silence. Tten, a hollow SOUND of wind rushing through sto
fills frame its gold-flecked iris staring evilly at us. (CONTINUED)
It's only a mangy TABBY CAT, standing in the middle of

Small] as a prison cell, made entirely of ancient rock. Dawnlight filters in from a slit in the wall. The Cat MEOWS, trying to get the attention of A MAN, asleep in a small cot. Dressed in fatigues, his fa turned from us, he does not seem about to get up. The Cat jumps up on a knickknack filled SHELF above the m head. It MEOWS again. The Man groans into his pillow.

Bugger off, Murphy. Undeterred, the Cat starts tapping a FRAMED PHOTOGRAPH wi its paw. It pushes the object over the edge of the shelf; the picture falls, landing a half-inch from the Man's hea We see it's a FAMILY PHOTO: Young Quinn standing with Kar The Man rolls over; we see his face. QUINN ABERCROMBY, now in his late 20s. A gentie, handsome face, one that's lived at great cost. Quinn picks up the photo, shakes it at the cat.
One a these days, you're not gonna miss. Quinn puts the photo on the shelf, then gently grabs the

Then where you gonna be, eh? He carries the cat through the room. PLANTS hang from the wall; A GOLDFISH TANK in one corner; a CAGE with MICE in another. An old SHEEP DOG huddles by the door. Quinn walks to what passes for a "pantry": a small sterno burner with an assortment of ancient food tins.
They'll try you. Convict you. Hang you. He empties a packet of DRIED MILK into a bowl, fills it w water from a canteen, stirs. (CONTINUED)
il.
Probably won't even give you a last meal. He sets the bowl on the floor. Murphy hungrily laps the m The Sheep Dog by the door BARKS.
Don't worry, I'm not playin' favourites. Quinn grabs a partially burned BOOK from a rickety shelf. Then, dog in tow, he heads out the door.
Quinn walks through a narrow hallway of ancient rock. A BOY AND GIRL (JARED, 11, and BETH, 9), faces stained wi soot, race around the corner and nearly knock into him.
Oy oy oy, Jared. Keep it under fifty.
Sorry, Chief. The children continue on with their chase-game. Yawning, Quinn walks on past the door to
CHOIR MUSIC within, intoning a Catholic "Kyrie". We see t source of the music is A SHORTWAVE RADIO near the lectern The music ends, and an ANNOUNCER'S VOICE comes over the radio, speaking in ITALIAN.
This is Vatican station, transmitting from temporary sanctuary in Sicilia... Quinn crosses himself as he walks by the chapel. He heads down a STONE STAIRCASE, which in turn opens out to

Three acres enclosed by 30 FOOT HIGH STONE WALLS. It's a cross between a medieval village and a modern refugee cam PEOPLE dressed in threadbare clothes go about morning business. Some cook on grills fueled by SOLAR BATTERIES; get water from wells pumped by WINDMILLS. Others tend LIV STOCK roaming freely through the area. Everyone has the lean, hungry look of wartime refugees. (CONTINUED)

Quinn walks by, nodding hellos. The residents' replies ar all respectful: "mornin', Chief...up early, Chief..." He heads to the back of the yard where sits DAVE CREEDY -- 30s, red-haired, the runt of a short litte His accent is Cumbrian: a dialect that sounds like a Scot brogue run through a blender. He is cooking something over a coal fire as Quinn approac
There's your man.
Give us a kiss.
Shave. Creedy hands him a cup of tea. Quinn looks down, sees wha his friend is cooking: a frighteningly runny CHEESE SANDW
What's this then?
\ (Proudly) Fookin' cheese toastie.
"Fookin' cheese," eh? (Inspects it.) From a cow or your toes?
Try it an' see. _ (OFF Quinn's look) Oh, don't be "Mr. Picky-Poo". I's good this time, I put chives in it. Quinn regards the oozing mess, politely shakes his head.
Since when'd you develop such a profoun'ly delicate palatte?
Since you found that damn cook book. Quinn rises, walks over to a set of STAIRS leading up to  13.

In what is obviously a morning ritual, Quinn paces the WALKWAY that runs the top of the wall. He leans against the battlement, pulls out the book he to from his shelf. It's a technical manual titled: OXYGEN UN REPAIR. He starts to read. PULL BACK SLOWLY TO REVEAL he is standing on the walls of

Its ancient towers outfitted with solar panels, barbed wi and rusting guns. Its formidable rock walls scarred with huge black SCORCH MARKS. Wounds from a war with fire. PANNING AWAY from the castle, we see the country it inhab A BURNT, DESOLATE LANDSCAPE. Nothing standing much less living. The ground is SLICK BL SLAG - as if it were burned, melted, then licked clean. It stretches to an ever-grey sky which itself seems scorc SUPERIMPOSE: WARWICKSHIRE, ENGLAND. 2024 A.D.
over the barren domain. All seems lifeless until we come CHARRED TREE, standing like a sentinel on a hill overlook

Acres of color -- amber barley, green stalks of corn and alfalfa -- all reclaimed from the sea of black. People from the castle are busy HARVESTING. Some use deca bits of technology -- tractors, mowers, bailers. Others u jury~rigged equipment pulled by animals. Around the fields are several old WATER TENDERS ~- firetr with huge water tanks and hoses. MEN IN FIREFIGHTING GEAR atop them, armed with old rifles, guns, even crossbows. They scan the cloud-covered sky, watching for signs of li
A group of twenty STUDENTS aged four to twelve sit raptil watching Quinn, who is acting out a story for them. (CONTINUED)

(In a deep basso.) “Join me" the Black Knight says, "and we can end this destructive conflict together." (In a younger voice.) "I'll never join you!" The White Knight cries. "You killed my father!" But the Knight in Black only stares at him, stares through the buggy eyes of his black mask. And then he speaks the words that burn into our hero's heart forever. (In deep basso.) "No, Luke. JI am your father... The kids GASP at the revelation.
You make that one up, Mr. Quinn?
I did. The Kids MUMBLE, impressed. Quinn winks at FAITH, 17, a s faced, ersatz school teacher who's barely through being a student. She blushes at Quinn's wink, turns to the kids.
Right then, loves. Time for maths. The Kids all protest.
Come on, now. Thank the Fire Chief for comin' to storytell.
Not yet! One more! Please! Please! Faith can't get a word in. She looks at Quinn, who smiles
All right. Just one...
“The one about the shark"! "The Indiana man"! "The Lion Thingy"! BETH, a shy girl of eight, speaks from the back.
Tell us about The Ashley. Everyone goes quiet at the mention of that name. Long pau (CONTINUED)
You've heard that one plenty, Beth.
Not the way you tell it. The children stare at him. Quinn glances at Faith, who no Quinn gestures the kids in; they gather around him in a t circle, as if it were a campfire tale.
Listen then. You've heard how they found The Ashley in London town. Asleep in her cave, she was, in water colder 'n' ice. So long in darkness, her skin was clear as glass.
How long she been there?
Thousands of years, Jared. Since the last ice age, even.
Was it magic she lived so long?

No, Beth. Some reptiles, they hibernate in the cold. Scientists reckon she slept without eatin'. Without breathin. Waitin for warmth to wake her. And it did... With his hands he casts SHADOW OF A WINGED SHAPE on the w
She rose into the sky that night, her skin turnin' the color of evening. Then like a ghost in the wind she disappeared. The hands' shadow vanishes.
A lone WATCHMAN stands atop the castle tower.

Oh, men looked for her, surely. Searched with machines from ocean to air. He scans the sky with an old coin-operated TOURIST BINOCU He puts coin slug after coin slug into it to keep it goin (CONTINUED)
(CONT'D)
But The Ashley was smart. She'd flown far into the Arab deserts...
A SENTRY squats in a stone hutch, watching the sky with a telescope.
.+.-and buried herself deep in the sands where nobody'd find her. Unseen by the man, something MOVES in the sky behind him.
huge yet nearly invisible. They BLEND IN with the smoky s chameleons turned the color of clouds.
A year later, that whole desert starts shiftin' an' shakin’, as if the sands "emselves were alive. And then... Quinn's HAND SHADOWS imitate the ground exploding.
Up they came! Thousands of thousands of them. The Ashley's brood. Takin' to the air like locusts.
POV OF THE AIRBORNE CREATURE -- looking down through the cloud cover at the living fields below.
They fell first on the cities...
(CONT'D)
...and then on the land. A WIND picks up. The charred tree trembles...then DISINTEGRATES INTO SWIRLING ASHES.  17.
The Kids look on expectantly.
And then?
As the wind picks up, the animals in the Courtyard react. Horses skitter. Dogs begin to HOWL and BARK.
Quinn suddenly stiffens, sensing something.
The Watchman suddenly spies something.
Oh, Christ! He immediately turns the crank of an AIR RAID SIREN. Its piercing WHINE cuts through the air.
Several Firemen atop a Tender look up just as CRACK!! An ARC OF PHOSPHOROUS LIGHTNING STRIKES THE TENDE The vehicle EXPLODES in a cloud of superheated steam.
Quinn gathers the students.
Jared, get ‘em to the cellars! Faith, you're with me...

The siren BLARES as Firemen on a second Tender desperatel try to extinguish the flames shooting up from the first.. Two other Firemen mount a decrepit WWII ANTI-AIRCRAFT GUN Terrified Farm Workers run SCREAMING for cover as... CRACK!! Another Phosphorous Arc strikes in the middle of corn field. The effect is like NAPALM -- A SWATH OF FIRE SCYTHING through the vegetation, consuming all in its pat  18.
The yard's in the grip of ordered panic. Like a city used war, PEOPLE run for pre-arranged protection of the castle towers as above the Watchman shouts
Quinn and Faith race to the yard's end to a

A rag-tag FIREHOUSE stocked with equipment that ranges fr modern day oxygen tanks to old hand-operated waterpumps. Quinn rushes to a TWO-WAY RADIO, flicks it on. CRIES and SOUNDS of a desperate battle are heard.
Justen? Talk to me!
Be're in the middle of the gobshite, Chief!
JUSTEN, 35, buff, firefighter, screams into a combat phon

= got three Tenders down and two worms in the air... His voice is drowned out by the BLAM BLAM BLAM of the Ant Aircraft gm as it BLASTS its shells into the sky above. The shells EXPLODE, pocking the cloudy air with black bur But the SHAZES easily avoid the blasts. Barely visible, t slide into tie clouds like snakes slithering under stones
Lesten to me: dig in an' hold your position. I'm comin' with back up. (No response.) Jweten? Only a STATICHISS from the radio. (CONTINUED)
Quinn looks up. Dave Creedy, Faith and TWENTY MEN AND WOM have joined him. They stare at Quinn in tense silence.
Suit up.

Clipped, staccato CLOSE-UPS of Quinn and Co. suiting up. They're like knights getting ready for battle: A thick ALUMINIZED FIRECOAT is thrown over Quinn's shoulders...An asbestos GAUNTLET/GLOVE is thrust over his hand...A PULASKI (double bladed hoe and axe) slides into SEEATH on his back...A FIREMAN'S HELM fits over his head. Finally, a plexiglass VISOR snaps down over his face.

The metal gates are thrown open...and Quinn CHARGES OUT, RIDING ATOP A HORSE, leading A RAGTAG FIRE BATTALLION on a range of vehicles: horse-dr FIRECARTS; LIGHT PUMPERS (mini-firetrucks the size of car a MACK AEPIAL (a truck witn a long extension ladder); and ALVIS SALAMANDER (armored 6-wheel ATV used for runway fir

Quinn pulls up short, looks down at the fields below. THE AREA IS AN INFERNO! Walls of THICK BLACK SMOKE rise i the air, backlit by orange flames. Above, a WWII MOSQUITO FIGHTER PLANE roars by, dumping RE FLAME RETARDANT FOAM over the fire. It does almost no goo Quinn speaks into a MIC set into his helmet.
Eddie, gimme the word...
EDDIE STAX -- 30s, cockney, so huge he barely fits into t cockpit -- stares out the window.
We got us a firebox, Quinn. EDDIE'S POV -- FIELDS BELOW. All four sides of the field area are BURNING, creating a literal box. Within, PEOPLE (CONTINUED)
running, choking, looking for an escape. Blinded by the b smoke, they can't see a way out; they're like rats ina tr
I count 30, maybe 40 people inside.
Any sign a the worms? Eddie sees a DISTANT SHAPE passing into the clouds above.
They're circlin'.
Keep ‘em off our backs. We're gonna try a rescue.
You mental?! That wind shifts, you got a firestorm. Neo one's gonna make it...
Just do it! Quinn turns to his "troops", now pulling up to the hill.

Listen up! All companies, we're gonna take this bastard on the west side. I want a 20 meter firebreak in ten minutes. (Dismounts from his horse) Danny, fit a 10-K searchlight to the Mack. My signal, you turn it on. Quinn jumps atop the Salamander which Creedy drives.
Bad news, Dave. You're with me.
What're we doin'?
Walkin' in God's garden...
The battallim charges down, splitting left toward the wes "wall" of the fire box. The Salamander breaks right, straight to tie east "wall" where the fire burns fiercest  21.
Andy, the plane's 20-year old tailgunner, nervously locks loads his gun as Eddie removes a MICROPHONE from his pane He flicks a switch marked PA SYSTEM. .
His voice BLARES over a LOUDSPEAKER on the plane's belly.
Taking notice of the Mosquito. We hear Eddie's voice as T CREATURES HEAR IT: a series of HARSH, GRATING NOISES.
Andy OPENS FIRE as the SHAPES start to head for the plane
The plane banks, leading the shapes away from the fields.
The fire companies are attacking the firewall: spraying water, using the pulaskis to create a firebreak.
The Salamander speeds toward a WALL OF FLAME. Quinn stand atop the vehicle, manning an artillery sized FIRE HOSE GU Creedy sticks his head out the window.
Creedy mumbles a prayer, then FLOORS the accelerator. The firewall GROWS till it fills his entire line of sight. TOP OF SALAMANDER -- Quinn sprays the fire, creating a br
The inside of the "firebox" is a maelstrom of BLACK-SMOFE peppered with RED HOT CINDERS. One can't see 5 feet ahead
It's gonna be hell findin' anybody!
Drive slow. They'll find us... Quinn points the nozzle out and begins SPRAYING water ina wide, slow arc into the smoke-choked fields.

A MAN and several CHILDREN struggle in the darkness, unab to see, barely able to breath. There seems to be no way o Suddenly, a SPRAY OF WATER pierces through the thick hot smoke, sprinkling their faces like a cool benediction.
Quinn keeps spraying as he calls into the black void.

His eyes are tearing from the smoke as he scans the darkn For a long moment, there is nothing. But then, through the clouds, they come. PEOPLE, coughing choking, drawn from the inferno by the life-giving water.
Hold on to the truck! They cling to the truck, which leads them through the dar
FLASH! A PHOSPHOROUS ARC cuts through the clouds like horizontal lightning. The Mosquito barely avoids it.

head_text.subj: IS THAT THE BEST YOU CAN DO

text: Andy looks out the window, shouts to him. Eddie sees that right engine is on fire. He switches frequencies on the m (CONTINUED)
Quinn...I got a flame out on number two. We gotta call it a day... EXT. SKY BY MOSQUITO - Day The Mosquito banks away, toward the safety of the castle.
A STRING OF PEOPLE now hold on to the Salamander for dear life. But it's a case of the blind leading the blind.
I can't see a bloody thing...
Settle down. (To Radio) Faith! How's my fireline?
The firemen have created a 20 meter BREAK in the fire wal It literally looks like a door out of hell. Faith speaks into her radio.
Right and ready, Chief.
That 10K rigged? Faith looks up to brigade lieutenant DANNY GOODWIN, age 3 who stands atop a THIRTY FOOT LADDER that extends from th Mack. A SEARCHLIGHT has been set upon it.
Ready, Chief.

Light ‘em up. Danny throws a switch. The searchlight FLICKERS ON EXT. FIELDS - By SALAMANDER - DAY The LIGHT PIERCES THROUGH THE SMOKE LIKE A KNIFE. A beaco to guide the Salamander out. Creedy LAUGHS. He drives toward the light. (CONTINUED)
But then Quinn hears a BOY shouting behind him.
Mr. Quinn! My sister...she let go... Quinn calls to Creedy.
Keep it movin', Dave! Quinn jumps off the back, heads toward the fields.
POV OF AIRBORNE CREATURES -- flying back toward the field
The Firemen rush to help the survivors into every vehicle gentle WHOOSH of a breeze is heard. Faith feels it first.
(Nervously, to walkie-talkie) Quinn...
Quinn picks up a barely conscious GIRL lying on the groun
Winds changin'. The fire's gonna flare... His radio SPUTTERS. Quinn taps it. No good. IT'S DEAD.
Quinn? Can you hear me? No response. Unsure of whether Quinn knows of the danger, she runs into the fields in search of her chief.
From his belt, Quinn pulls a FIRE SHELTER -- a floorless aluminum pup tent. He spreads it over himself and the gir He secures the edges with his boot tips and gloved hands.
Glynnis...we're gonna close our eyes an' stay flat. When I count three, you hold your breath. Can you do that for me? (CONTINUED)
The Girl nods, terrified. The roar of wind gets louder.
One...
Faith feels the wind. She pulls out her emergency shelter
Two... Faith tries to assemble it, but lacks Quinn's experienced calm. Her hands shake, costing her precious seconds.
Three. Quinn and the Girl breath deep.
WHOOSH! A GUST OF WIND sends fire FLARING OVER THE FIELDS It washes like a tsunami over Quinn's emergency shelter..
...and STRIKES FAITH FULL ON as she tries to get into her shelter. So quick, she never knew what hit her.
The Girl clutches Quinn as the fire FLARES over the shelt shaking and roaring as if it were a living thing.
The Salamander drives in. Danny's at the wheel, Creedy ma the water gun, spraying the fiery ground before him. He s Quinn's shelter, sprays the area around it.
Quinn! Quinn emerges from the shelter, the young girl in his arm
Move it! We got worms comin'! (CONTINUED)
(Handing girl to Danny) Where's Faith? Danny shakes his head. Quinn stares a second, unbelieving He turns, Starts to go look for the girl. Creedy stops hi
Quinn struggles; but Creedy is much stronger than he look He pulls Quinn back to the Salamander.
SHADOWS OF TWO WINGED FORMS pass over the land, flying no towerd the burning fields.
Chief, they're comin' down. You want a counterattack?
Quinn looks at the blackened, exhausted faces of his Fire
They'll just go airborne again. Hit us from the sky. Quinn stares out the window, his eyes weary, almost lifel
Pull back.
The battallion of fire vehicles beats a hasty retreat sou

The fire subsides. Once green fields are now nothing but Through smoke, we see SILHOUETTES OF TWO HUGE WINGED SHAP landing on the field. We don't get a full view of them; j CLOSE SHOTS of PARTS OF THEIR BODIES seen through the smo A CLAW/LEG -- the stunted limb of a beast not built for w WINGS -- veined, leathery, batlike. Folding silently agai (CONTINUED)

A GIANT TORSO -- 30-feet of slick, reptilian scales. The scales are the color of clouds. But as they near the char earth, they CHANGE HUE, turning the COLOR of the dark gro Finally -- and perhaps worst of all -- A HUGE MOUTH enter frame. Lips curled in the perpetual smile of a predator. Its teeth are like rows of sword-length RAZOR SHARP NEEDL A CABLE-LIKE TONGUE unwinds from its maw. It sweeps over charred ground and begins to rake in piles of ash. The mouth FEEDS ON THE ASH. Its needle-teeth MESH togethe creating a kind of filter which strains bits not complete burned: pieces of metal, wood and human bone. As the mouth works its meal, something falls from its lip The remains of Faith's scorched FIRE SHELTER. A RATTLING SOUND is heard, followed by a short BURST of PHOSPHOROUS FLAME. The fire consumes the shining tent, reducing the last remnant of the girl to ashes.
Lit by solar-powered floodlights, it looks like an island caught between dual voids of black sky and black earth.
Look, if my conscience could change the math, it would...
A council of Firemen -- Creedy, Danny, Eddie among them - argue around a long rusted table. Quinn sits at the head, examining a CHALKBOARD filled with numeric calculations.
But it's plain subtraction, all right? With those fields gone, we're not gonna have enough food for winter.
It's only August. We can still lay ina new crop...
With those worms out there?
They'll leave once they've fed. (CONTINUED)
That could be months.
You the bloody Almanac now?
No, Creedy, I just got bloody eyes...
(Calmly) All right, cut it down. The group shuts up. They stare at Quinn, who scratches recalculations on the board with a piece of chalk.

Now we still got the hydroponics. I can convert the main hall into a greenhouse. If we cut to half-rations...trade for seed with Edinburgh... Looks up at them.) It won't be a feast, lads, but it'll get folks through to March.
That's it, then? The grand solution? Quinn looks at him. Eddie shakes his head bitterly.
You got a problem with it?
Nooo. I think it's rosey-fuckin'-doo. (To the others.) We burrow like rats. Starve through another winter...
Eddie...
...meanwhile, Ashley squats in London, hatching her eggs. Come spring, her kids can just burn us out again...
All right.
It's not all right, Chief! HOW LONG WE
(CONTINUED)
Quinn sees the same question reflected in each of his firemen's eyes. When Eddie speaks again, it's a challenge
I'm for goin' to London. Quinn shakes his head. Eddie turns to the others.
Look, there's buildings still standin' there. Food. Medicine. If we knock out Ashley's nest, it's all ours...
We can't even handle the two worms here. You wanna pick a fight with their ma?!
I'd rather go out fightin' than starvin'.
An' take the whole castle with you? {Shakes his head.) We stick to the strategy.
(Icily) Same strategy that got Faith killed? The room goes dead quiet; Eddie's clearly crossed a line.
I say we put it to a vote. (To Quinn) Or you too much of a big girl's blouse? Quinn remains composed. He rises, chalkboard in hand.

All right. I can see there's a bit of division on the subject. (Starts walking around table) But let's not start callin' names, yeah? Least we owe each other is the courtesy of debating this like Englishmen... Quinn wheels round and BREAKS THE CHALKBOARD ON EDDIE'S H The firemen are taken aback. Quinn stands over Eddie. (CONTINUED)
Your first job's to this community. Not your damn pride. You wanna play buckaroo, join another brigade. Quinn tosses the broken chalkboard down to him, then leav
Quinn feeds his fish with GRUBS from a jar of earth. A KNOCK on the door. Creedy enters, carrying a plate fill with a scary looking potato. Quinn regards it dubiously.
What's this then?
Fookin' spud. (Sets it down) I simmered it in gravy; gave it a nice bouquet. Earthy. Kin' a mooshroomy...
Almost fungus-y.
Just eat it. Quinn smiles, takes the plate. Creedy sits on the bed; he's visibly on edge.
You been havin' conversations. Creedy tries to put it delicately.
There's some thinkin'...maybe Eddie's right. Quinn shakes his head.
Quinn, he's got a big mouth, but he's also got a point. We can't last here forever. Sooner or later, we gotta make a stand...
We are makin' a stand. (CONTINUED)
Quinn goes to the window, gestures out.

Look at it. Twenty years ago, you couldn't see the sky, there was so many of 'em. Ten years, you couldn't lay ina crop. Now we can. What's that tell you? Creedy rubs his eyes. They've been through this before.
We can outlast ‘em, Dave. Every year, there's less to burn, less ash for 'em to eat. They'll starve eventually. We just gotta hang on till...
Till when? You don't know.

I know Ashley. We go stirrin' her up, we'll be diggin’ graves for every man, woman an' child around. (Shakes his head.) I'm not partial to doin' that duty again. Creedy glances at a faded 20th-century POSTCARD on the wa a PHOTO OFA CASTLE with inscription: PEMBREY CASTLE.

That was eight years ago, mate. You can't keep blamin' yourself... Quinn suddenly stops, seeing something through the window BRIGHT LIGTS playing in the distance, slowly approaching. SHOUTS are Zeard in the hall outside. Danny runs in.
Wehicles comin'! (Nervously, to Quinn.) %E looks like a raiding party. Quinn and Geedy exchang= glances, then head for the door.

Alive with mmmotion. Quinn's Firemen run along the battlements, taking positions with guns, crossbows, etc. Armed with arold rifle, Quinn climbs up to the battlement He stares owover the walls. (CONTINUED)
WHITE LIGHTS dart wildly in the darkness over the ridge, accompanied by the distant ROAR OF VERY BIG ENGINES.
CLOSE SHOTS of WHEELS and TREADS of some seriously HEAVY VEHICLES. Chewing up and spitting out chunks of blackened ground as they grind toward the castle.
Quinn paces the battlements, commanding like a general.
Danny, take B company to the south wall. Eddie! Get that goddam howitzer up here! The ENGINE ROAR gets louder; the white lights closer.
The Watchman squints into his Tourist Binoculars.
a LICENSE PLATE attached to a yet unseen vehicle. It read NEW HAMPSHIRE. "LIVE FREE OR DIE". PULL BACK TO REVEAL it is attached to AN ABRAMS TANK. 46 tons. God's wrath in metal.
As they pull a Howitzer into position on the wall, Quinn Creedy get a glimpse of what's coming.
Say goodnight to the folks, Gracie...

EIGHT HEAVILY ARMORED VEHICLES follow the Abrams: BRADLEY ARMORED PERSONNEL CARRIERS bristling with guns; AML MINI- TANKS outfitted with HARPOON LAUNCHERS; and finally, a sc like MOWAG MISSILE CARRIER.
Firemen look at each other nervously. They're utterly outgunned. Quinn tries to keep them from panicking. (CONTINUED)
Easy, lads. We still got height on 'em. THE VERICLES' ROAR becomes deafening. In the blinding gla of their headlights, they look like a herd of metal monst Quinn takes a position at the wall.

Fire by file on my signal! THE VEHICLES keep coming. A WHIRRRR from the APCs. ARTILL GUNS SPROUT from wells at their top, aiming at CREEDY, who nervously mans the Howitzer. It's like facing down a bazooka with a water pistol.
Steady!! THE ABRAMS TANK turns its massive turret gun toward THE FIREMEN, holding position, keeping one eye on QUINN, who raises his arm, waiting till the enemy's in ra

Steady!! His arm is about to come down when suddenly THE VEHICLES STOP. That quickly. All noise fades into ech QUINN doesn't move. A long, eerie silence follows, broken THE ABRAMS TANK. A metallic CH¥-CHK-CHK is heard from its top-hatch. The hatch opens up with a heavy CLUNK! A scarred LEFT HAND appears, holding a PDW SUBMACHINE GUN An equally scarred RIGHT HAND appears, holding a CIGAR. The two arms work together to pull up their massive owner

30s, handsome, an American Achilles. The classical featur of a Roman general; the 1000-yard stare of a Vietnam vet. He surveys the landscape impassively, lights the cigar wi Zippo, takes a drag, then passes judgment. (CONTINUED)
(\ What...a...dump.
Quinn hears the man's accent, looks over at Creedy.
Americans?
You by the Howitzer! Creedy turns, sees Van Zan is talking to him.
Yeah, you, Sparky. Who's in charge?
What he call me?
Shhh...
‘ QUINN Shut your gob! Quinn pulls Creedy back. Beat. He yells back at Van Zan.
What's your business? Van Zan smiles.
Real estate.
Yeah, well, the market's a bit depressed right now. I advise lookin' elsewhere.
Relax, bro. We're here to make friends. Van Zan lays down his gun, jumps to the ground, raises hi empty hands in a sign of "truce". Long beat. Quinn considers, then calls out to him. (CONTINUED)
Keep your vehicles back. I'll meet you at the gate. Van Zan begins walking toward the castle. Quinn gives Creedy his rifle.
He tries anything, you know what to do. It's plain from Creedy’s face he hasn't any idea.
Quinn nods to a Firemen. The man opens the gate, revealin Van Zan, standing casually on the other side. The two men look at each other a moment, sizing one another up.
I'm told in Medieval days, two Kings'd meet, they'd exchange the kiss of peace. (Extends his hand.) I'll settle for a handshake.
Back then, they shook hands to see if there were weapons up their sleeves. Quinn takes Van Zan's hand. Not as much a greeting as a method of immobilization. For a moment, neither man lets
What's your game, mate? You tradin'’ or attackin'?
That depends on you, "Mr. Buddy".
I ain't your "buddy".
And I ain't your "mate". But that doesn't mean we can't come to an agreement. (Gestures back to his vehicles.) My boys are kinda tired. Long trip, bad food. We were hopin' for accommodations.
What's it worth to you? (CONTINUED)
Van Zan removes a PACK from his shoulder, hands it to Qui It's filled with army issue C-RATIONS.
100 pounds of C-rations. Plus freeze- dried ice-cream for the kids. Quinn considers a moment, then tosses the bag back at him
I think you can do better. Van Zan remains pleasant, but shows a flash of teeth as h tosses the bag back at him.
You know...you're really not ina position to negotiate. Van Zan nods in the direction of his mini armada. Quinn takes it in stride, throws the bag back at him.
I reckon I'm doin' all right. Quinn nods up to his armed men lining the battlements. Van Zan smiles, knowing they're even. He holds out the ba this time a little more congenially.
Okay, friend. 150 pounds.
200. And that's just for one night.
Done. Quinn goes to take the bag. Van Zan grabs his hand.
But you don't get any ice cream. Quinn allows himself a smile. He takes the bag.
Van Zan's armada enters through the gates into  37.
Residents line up to gawk at the new arrivals. Quinn and Firemen watch, their weapons at the ready.
"Denton Van Zan"?
That's what he calls himself.
Sounds like a blood disease. They ship all that shite over?
Transport plane. Crash-landed off the coast.
What the hell are they doing here? Quinn is silent. He just stares at
Van Zan sits atop the moving tank, waving to the people w all of the confidence of Patton entering Palermo.
Evenin'...nice to be here...thanks for watching... SEVERAL KIDS touch his tank in fascination.
"Scuse me. The kids look up. Van Zan stares down at them coldly.
Do I play with your tank? Beat. The kids all shake their heads.
Then don't mess with mine. Scram. And they do.
Creedy watches Van Zan's MEN unpack their vehicles. They' scarred, hardened folk who've spent much time in the fiel (CONTINUED)

He netices a shrimpy 16-year old KID unloading his gear f a truck. The boy has NO LEGS. Just tied off stumps at his hips. None of his comrades make any attempt to help him. Moved by the sight, Creedy walks over to him.
Need a hand there, lad? The Kid draws a huge SHOTGUN from a sheath on his back.
Suck my dick. Creedy goes crimson. A deep LAUGH is heard behind him. Creedy turns to see GID -- black, 30s, seven-feet of post-apocalyptic rasta man.
He fine by himself, mon. Da Pope don't like charity. Creedy looks back at the kid, who shall now be known as
"The Pope"? Before Creedy can say more, the SOUND OF ROTORS is heard.
A WASH OF WIND AND LIGHT comes over the crowd.

Ladies and gentlemen, you all might want to move back a bit... The crowd rushes to get out of the way of A Blackhawk "" HELICOPTER, descending from the heavens. I nestles down into the middle of the Courtyard.
Aw, spiffy... But his attitude changes when the pilot appears at the do COLLEEN BEANE -- 20s, small build, enigmatic eyes. Her perpetual dress is a unisex flight-suit and combat boots.
What took you, Beane? (CONTINUED)

(Laughs) What took me? Your coordinates, my man. They almost took me to France. (Puts her arm on his shoulder) Not that I couldn't use the vacation... The two walk off. Quinn finds himself staring at her. Not because it's a female pilot; rather, because it's one of those times when he can't help himself.
Creedy walks with Van Zan, who carries The Pope back-to-b via a harness. Pope hangs from the man like a weird knaps
I take it you watch his back.
No, Sparky. He watches mine. PAN OVER TO Colleen and Quinn, walking behind them. Colle looks around the area, inspecting the castle walls.
I've never seen a base like this. It pretty secure?
We moved into here after the other buildings were destroyed. The Normans built their castles to last.
Normans?
Norman dynasty. Y'know, Richard the Lionheart.
He your Fire Chief?
Ah...no. He was a king back in the...
I was kidding. Quinn looks at her, surprised. He chuckles. (CONTINUED)
That's good. You got me. You didn't look like someone who'd do that.
Looks can be deceiving.
Names are a bit more straightforward. (Offers his hand.) Quinn.
Colleen. They take each other's hand.
Bunking down in the straw, The Pope unlatches his guitar case. Colleen checks out one of the horses, patting its n Quinn watches her from the door as Creedy talks with Van
»+-Clean up afterwards. An' no funny stuff with the livestock.
We'll try to contain ourselves. Creedy goes to the door. Quinn turns to Colleen.
Sleep well. Van Zan claps a friendly/warning hand on Quinn's shoulder
We'll sleep light. Quinn smiles thinly.
By a stunning coincidence, so will we...
Weapons armed, Quinn and the firemen stand post on the ba ments, tensely watching for any treachery from the Yanks.  41.
— Van Zar looks through the slats. He smiles at The Pope.
Think they know what they're in for? The Pope smiles back. He pulls a ROCKET PROPELLED GRENADE LAUNCHER (RPG) from his case. It gleams balefully in the lantern light.
The sun rises in the smoke filled sky.
Quinn slumped asleep by the battlement, rifle in his hand Creedy nudges him.
The, ah, Lord of the Americas desires your presence in the Courtyard.

( Hah? Quinn looks down. At the end of the courtyard, Van Zan si surrounded by Quinn's firemen. They've put down there weapons and listen intently to him, like kids at a camp f QUINN (cont'd) Bloody shaggin' hell...
You might wanna talk to him, Quinn.
What? Why?
He says he's a dragonslayer.
Jared and Beth play with Van Zan's discarded cigar butts.
No no no, it's like this... (Takes a drag, imitates Van Zan.) ( “What a dump!" (CONTINUED)
Jared, get that outa your mouth! Quinn grabs the cigar as he walks hurriedly by with Creed CREEDY © ..-he says they killed ten of ‘em in Chicago. Ten! Gideon the rasta man passes by.
Top a da mohnin'.
Jah-love... (To Quinn) They practically cleaned out Los Angeles.
Van Zan sits on his tank, holding court to the firemen. T Pope sits below him, an obnoxious court jester.
.»..the worst? Hell, I'd have to say...
Grand Canyon.
Oh, yeah. That was a turdsucker...
Oy! Beowulf! Quinn approaches him. Beat. The two eye each other.
I'm told you're a scrapper. Beat. Van Zan removes a pair of MIRROR LENSE SUNGLASSES f his pocket, puts them on as if he was a celebrity.
My associates and I have been known to “scrap” things from time to time...
Quinn and the inner circle of firemen sit at the council table. Facing them are Van Zan and The Pope, both wearing sunglasses and looking very much the cool customers. (CONTINUED)
A hundred and fifty?!
One fifty three to be exact.
Keep a score-card, do ya?
(Deadpan) We have a newsletter.
Wait a sec, Rambo: last I knew, it took eight fighter jets just to kill one...

Sure. In the old days. (Rises, begins to pace.) First we used fighters. Then nerve gas. Then nukes. Hell, we lost more people to collateral damage than we ever did to the snakes. It's no miracle they overran us. He's come to the head of the table. He stares at Quinn.

But they can be killed, folks. Cleanly. Easily. No stress, no mess. Just takes a little bit a "this"... (Taps his head. And a little bit a "this". (Holds out his “fuck you" finger.) Silence. The firemen look to their leader for a response. Quinn stands up, stares at Van Zan a long moment.
How much a "this"... (Holds up his own "fuck you" finger) ...to get rid a the two we got here? Van Zan looks at Quinn's finger challengingly.
How much you got? Beat. Quinn nods at his council. One by one, each of his raises their middle finger. A forest of fuck yous sprouts Van Zan smiles. He likes that. He likes it a lot.  44.
First off, you have to know your enemy. REVEAL Van Zan addressing an assembly of ALL OF QUINN'S FIREMEN. He talks with the energy of a powerbroker.
Worms, snakes, dragons. You deal with ‘em every day; but what do you know about ‘em? He picks out one tow-headed young ROOKIE FIREMAN
You: Jughead. The Rookie nervously stands, as if he was in class.
Well, they...they're a kind a dinosaur...
Pre-dinosaur, Einstein. Cambrian species. Crawled out of a much scarier swamp than you ever did. (To the others.) Anyone tell me why they eat ash? All are silent. Finally it's Quinn who speaks up.
They can only digest pure carbon. Van Zan raises his eyebrow, mock-impressed.
So how come we never found any fossils?
They burnt each other for food. You're not tellin' me anything new, mate. Van Zan smiles a challenging smile.
I'm tellin' you the big picture...
THUNK! A GIANT DRAGON-HIDE SCROLL is unrolled down the ai (CONTINUED)
They're like locusts. On it has been painted A SERIES OF PICTURES, like the Bay tapestry, showing the life cycle of dragons.
Every 50,000 years, they come up, breed and burn, eat and starve. Van 2an walks down the aisle, talking to the castle RESID who are crammed into the hall trying to get a look.

They didn't just kill the dinosaurs, folks. They're responsible for every Major die-off on this planet. Ash they threw in the air caused nuclear winters that started the freakin' ice-ages. PAN OVER the standing room crowd. Quinn watches at back.
Oh, a few of 'em survived between cycles. Probably gave rise to the legends.
So you don't put stock in the myths then?
What, that they're the "scourge of God"? (Laughs. ) No. We make the myths. He looks at a stained glass depiction of the CREATION OF
As for the "Scourge of God" -- you're talking to him.
Just Van Zan and Quinn now, sharing a bottle of Glenfiddi
So now you wanna "scourge" for us?
Mr. Buddy, I can have you sowin' crops by Monday and eatin' pretty all winter.
Just what do you get out of it? (CONTINUED)
Ven Zan looks out the window.

I've seen a 1000 communities like yours, Quinn. Scared. Starving. Fighting a war of attrition till the snakes go away. (Turns to him.) Well, they won't. Not till we've pulverized, excised and atomized them off our God-given planet. Van Zan walks to the table, an odd light in his eyes.
See, what people don't realize is...this ain't no disco. (Smiles .) It's a motherFUCKIN' HOLY WAR! BAM! He BANGS the table so hard it nearly cracks.
So that's it, eh? You want recruits.
You got a problem with that?
What I got is 300 people lookin' for protection. You want to help ‘em, fine. But I'll not have 'em be fodder for a personal fuckin' Jihad...
Come off it, Chief. We all got scores to settle with 'em.
I've learned to live with it.
No offense, but I think you've learned to take it up your Limey butt. Beat. Van Zan's crossed that line. Quinn rises, comes fac face with him, deadly polite.
It's a “British butt". An' I'm not in the habit of takin' anything there. Includin' your General Patton attitude. (CONTINUED)
If it wasn't for Patton, you people'd be speaking German.
If it wasn't for my people, you wouldn't be speakin' English. Tense moment...which is broken by Van Zan's easy grin.

Least we can understand each other. (Offers his hand) Do this one job together. If you like the collaboration...we'll talk about others. Quinn stares into Van Zan's eyes. Is he making a deal wit savior? Or a devil? A moment of decision. Quinn spits into his own palm. Van Zan smiles, does likew Their hands come together with a SLAP!
Van Zan's militia gears up.
(CONT'D)
Four easy steps to this, people. Get it right or get a priest.
Van Zan addresses Quinn's Firemen.
One: knock 'em outta the air...
Colleen attaches MISSILES to the copter's fuselage.
They may be hotshit up there... Nearby, Gideon and TWO MEN assemble bizarre-looking BODY HARNESSES. (CONTINUED)
(CONT'D)
+..but they're jackshit down here.
Two: stop their flame... He picks up some stones, shakes them. It sounds like the same RATTLE the dragons make.
They rattle rocks in their throats to spark their phosphorous.
MAN-SIZE HARPOONS are fit in LAUNCHERS on the AML MINITAN
If you hold the bastards down, then hit ‘em in the gut... HUGE SHELLS are loaded into the Abrams Tank.
Van Zan tosses pebbles onto the dirt floor like dice.
They'll spit 'em up every time. Which brings us to "three". (Taps bottom of his throat.) Gland that secretes their napalm is here.
The Pope slides a rocket bolt into the weapon.
Put a good-size grenade down there... The bolt locks into place with a sinister CLICK.
-..and you're all ready for step "four".
What might that be? (CONTINUED)
Van Zan smiles evilly. As if to say: "you'll see".
Van Zan's militia moves out, flanked by Quinn's firemen. FLAGS fly from each vehicle: the original U.S. flag of 17 A PICTURE OF A SNAKE with the logo: DON'T TREAD ON ME.

Vehicles are strategically placed on what looks like a ba Mmoonscape. BURN SHADOWS of a once lush forest are etched the stone. The only sound is the fluttering of flags. FIND Quinn, talking to his men.
-..we stay outa the perimeter till the order comes. Last thing I need is one a you tossers gettin' dusted.
Where you gonna be?
Denton wants him in the chopper. Quinn turns to see Colleen approaching.
I don't take orders from your boss, lass.
That's okay. You can take ‘em from me.
Ooococoh. . Quinn blushes despite himself. Colleen smiles.
You want to see how this works, right? Beat. Quinn looks up toward Van Zan, who stands on a hill nearby. The American speaks into a headset.
All units, this is Good Shepherd. Let's get ready for the revival...  50.
Van Zan's men throw DARK COLORED NETTING over their vehic camouflaging themselves in the black blasted landscape.
Gideon and TWO MEN secure their "harnesses" in the hold. Quinn belts up in the copilot seat, Colleen next to him. casts a glance at her. She notices.
What?
I was just thinkin'. I've only seen you in that jumpsuit. I was wonderin' if you'd like some other clothes.
Your straps're on wrong. She moves to help him.
You ever been up in one of these?
Bh. No. I've just flown planes.
Well, this is a lot different. (Fastens his buckle.) Whatever you do, don't touch anything. QUINN ; You're makin' that a tad difficult. He smiles. She blushes despite herself, clips his belt.
Van Zan goes to the driver's seat. There sits GOOSH -- st hippy-like demeanor, zapped out eyes. Imagine Dennis Hopp APOCALYPSE NOW as a disc jockey.
What's the theme?
Hard-core. (CONTINUED)
Awesome. Goosh nods. He presses a couple of buttons on his console Several INDUSTRIAL SIZED AMPLIFIERS lift up from the top the carrier. Van Zan picks up a mic from the vehicle. His voice blares
Ladies and gentleman, are we ready to rock?! Van Zan's soldiers give a ROUSING CHEER.
Yeah!
The Englishmen look at each other nervously.
AR WHEEL on a CD PLAYER turns, CLICKS into place. A HARD-CORE INDUSTRIAL SONG blasts from the speakers.
Quinn looks at Colleen, who flips circuit breakers overhe
Sound lures 'em in, screws with their hearing. They don't like music.
And it takes our mind off dis crazy shit.
Van Zan is doing a passionate "air guitar” duet with The Pope, who uses his RPG as a guitar.
Creedy's face falls; the sanity quotient ain't lookin' hi (CONTINUED)
We are so fookin' fooked.
The Blackhawk leaps into the air like a dog off its chain The music rises with it. A clarion call to battle...
Through a cloud-choked sky, moving far, far away. The mus becomes faint...fainter...until it's a whisper in the win But then, just as it's about to become inaudible
Coming from the opposite direction. We hear the music as CREATURE HEARS IT: as sharp, disjointed SCREECHES. The thing banks through a cloud toward the sounds.
A BLIP appears on a RADAR SCREEN. The RADAR OPERATOR spea
Good Shepherd, this is Oracle. We have a visitor to the revival...
The man's voice is heard over the headset.
5 klicks, forty degrees North Northeast.
Seraph, you copy that?
Colleen responds into her radio.
Seraph copies. We're at two thousand fee and ready to dance.
Dress the angels. (CONTINUED)
Colleen makes a handsign to Gideon and his friends. They begin to put on their metal "harnesses".
Its nearly invisible SHAPE slips easily through the heave
The blip on screen has moved closer to the center.
Visitor is three klicks and closing...
Gideon and his cohorts insert themselves into the harness BRACES over their legs; METAL RODS along their chests; RI attached to their stomachs; PACKS on their back.
Angels are ready.
Van Zan scans the sky with his binoculars.
Send 'em out.
Quinn watches, perplexed, as Gideon goes to the CARGO PASSENGER DOOR on the right. Gideon flashes a smile.
You wanna dance wid da Devil, you gotta walk wid da Lord... He opens the cargo door. Then, with the grace of a cliff diver, he LEAPS OUT.

Gideon falls, his two pals right behind him. Bodies rigid they hurtle zoward the ground like knives. Gideon mouths a countdown, then grabs the two METAL RODS run along his chest. What follows is instantaneous: He flips out his hands and the metal rods... His legs do a SCISSOR KICK; the leg braces lock with a SN (CONTINUED)
His backpack OPENS...A BLOOM of fabric appears...
The Firemen watch, slack jawed.
You got to be joking.
Colleen smiles wryly at Quinn's surprise.
Good Shepherd, the angels are flying. EXT. SKy - DAY

head_text.subj: THE HARNESSES HAVE OPENED INTO BIZARRE-LOOKING HANGLIDERS

text: The invention could be out of a Da Vinci drawing; the ima out of a religious painting. For the three men GLIDING ea through the air look literally like angels.
The blip has gotten closer to the center of the screen.
Visitor is two kilometers and closing.
A FLICK of a tail is seen; a GLANCE of a leathery wing.
Aerial units, lock and load.
Colleen flips the safety of her Armament Fire Control Swi

Gideon removes what looks like a staff from his stomach. see it is an incredibly LONG RIFLE. A CANNISTER WITH SPIK (a "Sonic Grenade") is fit snugly into the barrel. THE TWO OTHER HANGLIDERS (ARCHANGELS #1 & #2) follow suit  55.
The blip on screen is closer...closer...
One kilometer...
Quinn sees something's emerging from the clouds ahead.
The blip enters the radar's inner circle.
21l units...visitor has arrived.
And like a child's nightmare, it emerges from the clouds

Its huge body is dwarfed by the span of its massive wings VESTIGIAL LEGS line its scaly torso, their claws opening closing reflexively. If Giger were to mate with the Broth Grimm, this is the abomination they'd spawn.
We got us an Adolescent. Worker Class. Fifteen meters and ready for a fight. Van Zan's face is impassive as a mountain.
Tet's give it some religion.
Colleen presses the ARMAMENT FIRE switch.
The MISSILES burst forth, tearing through the air toward.
which ares ard avoids the first missile. The second DETONATES bereath its tail. No damage; just annoyance. (CONTINUED)
The creature rears back like an airborne cobra. A RATTLIN is heard from its throat... And a BLAST OF PHOSPHOROUS LIGHTNING BURSTS FROM ITS MOUT
swerves, barely missing getting fried. It arcs, speeding away from the monster.
Quinn looks out his side window to see
Giving chase, the way a wolf would run down a rabbit.
The Blackhawk banks and swerves in evasive action; the creature can't get a clean hit with its phosphorous. But the rate its closing, in a few seconds, it won't matter.
Quinn stares at Colleen, handling the many controls like virtuosc organist. She's pretty calm, given the situation
Anything I can do?
Nah. Quinn looks out the window.
Trust me. We're being watched over.

is now within spitting distance of the Blackhawk. Its maw opens, its throat starts RATTLING... WHAM! A spiked SONIC GRENADE CANNISTER SLAMS into the bea neck. It CLAMPS to the skin and emits a deafening WHINE. The Dragon reels back to see
sweeping by with amazing grace. (CONTINUED)
{Into his helmet mic) Seraph, this is Archangel One...
-..we got it from here. Quinn looks out the window.

head_text.subj: THE HANGLIDING "ANGELS" ARE BATTLING THE DRAGON MID-AIR

text: It's an awesome sight. Their long rifles look like ANGEL STAFFS. Against the behemoth, Gideon and his men seem as sparrows trying to bring down an eagle. The Dragon twists, trying to get a fix on the annoying gn It sees Archangel #1, lets out a phosphorous stream. Archangel #1 easily banks away... ...and Archangel #2 closes in. He raises his rifle, FIRES His sonic grenade SLAMS into the Dragon's face like a bur The Dragon begins to thrash in pain.
(Into helmet mic) Gideon, it's all yours.
Gideon glides almost listlessly. His glider sweeps up...a then PLUNGES DOWN -- like a hawk going in for the attack
neither hears nor sees him.
holds out his rifle, takes aim.
All right, snake... (Finger tightens on trigger) .-here's mud in your ear. He FIRES! (CONTINUED)
The sonic grenade SLAMS into the exposed stretched TYMPAN of the Dragon's ear. It GOES OFF IN A HIGH-PITCHED WHINE.

We hear it as the beast hears it: AN UNENDURABLE BLAST OF SOUND. The Dragon shakes its head to disengage the grenade. But metal is deeply embedded in its ear, and its legs are too short to get to it. There's no way to dislodge it in the So the beast does the only thing it can; it descends.
watch in awe as the monster falls.
I call that a bloody miracle.
(Nods at Van Zan) I think he calls it "step one”...
Van Zan yells into his headset.
Jonah units, fall in! THE AML MINI-TANKS speed over the ground, their harpoon launchers lowering as they approach
The Dragon COMES DOWN to earth, thrashing violently. It drags its head over the ground, scraping the sonic gre from its ear. But it's no sooner done that when...

The First Mini-tank FIRES ITS HARPOON! The projectile kni through the air, connected to the tank by a WIRE ON A WIN SHHHK! It PIERCES the Dragon under its RIGHT WING. The Second Mini-tank FIRES its harpoon, which strikes int the Dragon on the opposite side, under the LEFT WING. (CONTINUED)
Ww 59.

The Dragon is now pinioned on both sides -- like Gulliver tied down by the Lilliputians. It struggles, trying to fr itself. And that's just when THE ABRAMS TANK rolls into view. The Dragon BLASTS it with fire. A flaming "fuck you".
RAMSEY, the tank gunner, takes aim.
Fuck you, too.
The Abrams BLASTS a TWO FOOT SHELL right back at the mons It STRIKES the Dragon right by its belly. The monster twi in a spasm...and two huge BOULDERS come up from its mouth
Danny Goodwin looks over at Creedy. He holds up two finge "step two".
Missionaries, move in!
There is movement, as if the ground has become alive. It' Van Zan's FOOT SOLDIERS, camouflaged against the scorched earth. They run forward into battle, guns a-blazing!
sees this is the moment. He turns to the Firemen.
Rifles in hand, Creedy and his men leap from their positi with an exuberant WAR CRY! Like a scene from a WWII battle, Englishmen join with Americans in a final, savage charge toward
(CONTINUED)
now unable to use its wings or fire. It can only LASH OUT with its cable-like tongue, trying to retrieve the boulde that will allow it to reignite its flame.
(To the Fireman)

text: A HAIL OF GUNFIRE. The Firemen let loose with everything they've got, keeping the dragon away from the boulders. The Dragon's tongue whips out, SKEWERING A FIREMAN RIGHT THROUGH THE TORSO. Its head STRIKES FORWARD LIKE A SNAKE, GRABBING A FOOTSOL AND TEARING HIM TO PIECES IN ITS SWORD-LENGTH TEETH. But another Soldier unleashes a barrage of EXPLOSIVE-TIPP BULLETS AT THE DRAGON'S FACE, SEVERING ITS TONGUE. The creature is now utterly defenseless. It's payback tim

All units...stand by for communion. The footsoldiers begin to pull back; the firemen follow t Van Zan walks over, bearing The Pope on his back, backpac style. He walks with the measured steps of an executioner
(To Creedy) "Step three"? Van Zan stops a ways from the Dragon. He glares at it lik general meeting a vanquished, unrepentant foe. The Dragon HISSES and SPITS. It's difficult to know who hates who mo
(To The Pope) Bless him. In a weird Janus moment, Van Zan turns his back on the Dragon, thus turning The Pope toward it. The Pope raises RPG, rests it on his and Van Zan's shoulders.
In the name of the father.. (He takes aim.) And the son... (Puts finger on trigger) And the holy ghost... (CONTINUED)
The Dragon opens its mouth to HISS in defiance.
Buh-bye. The Pope FIRES! The grenade rocket bursts from the RPG... ...into the creature's mouth... ...and the Dragon EXPLODES IN BLAST OF PHOSPHOROUS!
who now understands the meaning of step number...
He grabs the firemen nearest him, dives for cover as THE BATTLEGROUND IS FLOODED WITH BURNING DEBRIS. Chaos for a moment. Then, slowly, the debris settles.

look up. There's barely enough dragon left to bait a hook Van Zan lights his cigar from a burning piece of debris, strikes a somber pose of victory over the incinerated cor A CLICK-FLASH from a camera is heard-seen. FIND a Soldier taking Van Zan's pictures with an old polaroid.

Okay. Now a profile... Van Zan shifts his pose. CLICK-FLASH. As for the Firemen, there's only a stunned silence. Final Eddie Stax breaks it. He begins to clap his hands. The others join in. The applause grows into rousing CHEER
Quinn can't believe his eyes. He LAUGHS.
Then, aS if out of nowhere, ANOTHER BLIP appears on scree  62.
Quinn looks through the chin bubble...and reacts. He grab the COLLECTIVE CONTROL STICK by Colleen's left, pulls. it
The Blackhawk SHOOTS UP VERTICALLY, just in time to avoid
A SECOND DRAGON, lashing at the copter's rails with its t
The Radar Operator is heard over Van Zan's headset.
Shepherd, we got another! Slipped right under the goddam radar... Van Zan immediately moves back into action.
All units, BACK TO ONE!!
banks away, the Second Dragon behind them. It's one-and-a half times the size of the last one; sleeker, deadlier.
Be advised. This one's a Full Adult Soldier. Very smart, very pissed.
Colleen calls over the radio.
Archangel, what's your position?
Gideon and his "angels" are only a hundred feet above gro
No good, Coll! We're too far down!
Colleen swears, then speaks into the radio. (CONTINUED)
Releasing countermeasures... She presses a SWITCH on her Cyclic Control.
a CARGO DOOR on the bottom opens up, releasing THIRTY SON GRENADES, each with A SMALL PARACHUTE. They fly into the like flowers scattered to the wind.

passes through the parachutes. The whine of the sonic grenades deflect its focus off the helicopter, the way a submarine's countermeasure would deflect a torpedo But this ruse only works for a moment. After burning seve of the decoys, its back on the trail of the Blackhawk.
observes from the ground. Worried.
It's not going for it, Colleen.
Colleen's brow is knit in concentration.
Continue evasives and get the hell out...
It's kinda late to turn the other cheek. Quinn looks out the window toward the dragon...then towar the back of the helicopter toward a WINCH AND CABLE.
How strong is that cable? Colleen looks at him.
looking throagh binoculars.
Wha. the...? The BLACKHAWK is turning IN THE DIRECTION OF THE DRAGON.  64.
Quinn is tying the cable around his waist.
This is crazy...
So's everything else I've seen. (Smiles at her.) By the by, if it doesn't work...this was a grand first date. And with that, Quinn SLIDES OUT OF THE CHOPPER ON THE CAB
Date?
Quinn dangles twenty feet down the cable. His weight on t cable causes it to remain vertical like plumb line. The Blackhawk begins to accelerate toward
which keeps coming. It's like a game of aerial chicken.
screams into his headset.

text: Colleen doesn't answer, just keeps her focus on
which begins its fire-rattle.
Hanging on as the behemoth moves toward them.
(Into his headset) Remember, go for the joint...  65.
blasts out a PHOSPHOROUS ARC!
Colleen throws the Cyclic to the left with all her might.
THE BLACKHAWK TURNS SIDEWAYS, so that it's rotors are now degrees. It misses the phosphorous bolt... Quinn swings to the right...

text: Colleen barely manages to hold onto the controls as
Quinn holds on for dear life while the cable CUTS THROUGH dragon's bone and into the membrane of the wing.
Oh, this was a bloody bad idea... Quinn is PULLED THROUGH THE MEMBRANE OF THE WING!
CRIES OUT IN RAGE! It begins to plummet, its torn wing streaming like a tattered banner.
sees the second dragon falling. He nods, impressed.
That's original. He runs with The Pope for its landing site.
Colleen stabilizes the Blackhawk. Still flying, still ali
Quinn!! Are you okay?  6€.
Hanging on, his entire body covered with dragon blood.
Spiffy, luv. I'm... LIGHTS AND ELECTRICITY in the chopper suddenly die.

hurtles helplessly downward begins its own form of defens It executes a bizarre aerial manoeuver. It STRAIGHTENS it body out vertically like an arrow, then begins to SPIN, wrapping its head and body protectively its good wing. The result is a finely honed spear, plummeting to earth.
knows exactly what it's doing.
You little...
STRIKES into the earth head first! The creature BURROWS I THE GROUND LIKE A WORM, disappearing in seconds.
Oh yeah? You wanna burrow on me?! (To headset) Set a sonic on that son-of~a-bitch!
The Radar Qerator turns to a SECOND SCREEN.
Switching to ultra-sound. The screen somes on. It begins a SUBTERRANEAN SCAN.
Colleen flips the circuits but it is no good. Power's gon
(Into headset) Ive lost power. We're gonna have to aiwworotate!  67.
Quinn looks down.
(Into headset) Would that be anything like falling? The copter moves to a flat pitch, allowing some lift to t rotors. Stiil, it's VERY much like falling.
Right... He starts climbing as the copter descends hellishly fast.
Everybody's dead quiet. Van Zan whispers to The Pope.

Get ready. It could surface anywhere. The Pope nods, starts to reload the RPG. Van Zan looks up He sees the Blackhawk descending from the heavens. VAN ZAN (cont'd) (To headset) Colleen, you're coming down in the middle of my battlefield!
struggling to climb back up before the copter crash-lands
(To headset)
The Radar Operator watches the ultra-sound. A BLIP appear
Shepherd, we got a fix...
Van Zan is caught between listening to the headset and watching the Blackhawk's crash-landing. (CONTINUED)
39 degrees West...

on his back, attached to Van Zan's back by his harness. H RPG is just a few feet away. He reaches for it, but is restrained by the harness. Just then hears a RATTLING right behind him. He turns to

text: Oh, cr... SMASH! The Dragon SINKS ITS RAZOR SHARP TEETH into his to The Pope SCREAMS as the creature lifts both him and Van Z still attached to the boy by the harness -- into the air. Van Zan comes to as the creature shakes its head violentl The Dragon's teeth have fortunately not penetrated him. He pulls a BUCKLE on the harness, releasing him. He is thrown to the side...tucks and rolls as he hits the groun
